knimeNode.name: Bitvector Generator
knimeNode.shortDescription: Generates bitvectors either from a table containing only numerical values, or from a string column containing the ids to be set.

fullDescription.intro: Generates bitvectors either from a table containing only numerical values or from a string column. In the case of numerical values, a threshold must be defined. Assuming you have an n x m matrix A of numerical values: the ouput would be n x 1, where the only column contains bitvectors of length m. If the value in row n and column m is above the threshold, the m-th bit in the n-th bitvector is set. In the case of a string column, the string column is considered to consist of item ids present in this transaction, therefore, the string is parsed and for every id, the referring bit is set in the bitvector. Finally, all bitvectors are of the length of the highest id+1.
fullDescription.option: Check, if the input for the bitvectors is a string column with the item ids present in the referring transaction. Uncheck, if the data is a table with numerical data only and all values above a certain threshold should be set bits in the resulting bitvectors.

option.name: String column containing the item ids

fullDescription.option: If the "parse from string column" is checked, select the column containing the item ids.
If the "parse from string column" is unchecked, definition of the threshold above the values is considered to be set bits. The threshold is inclusive.

option.name: Use a percentage of the mean values as threshold

fullDescription.option: Check, if a percentage of the mean of each column should serve as threshold above which the bits are set.
Specify which percentage of the mean should have a value that is set to the referring bit.

dataIn.name: Input data to create bit vectors from

ports.dataIn: Datatable with numerical data or a string column to be parsed.

views.view: Provides information about the generation of the bitsets from the data. In particular this is the number of processed rows, the resulting bitvector length, the total number of generated zeros and ones and the resulting ratio from 1s to 0s.
